column4: can someone please help with an update-initramfs bug in which it runs but never does anything?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure grub
then sudo update-grub
update-initramfs runs but never finishes, never throws an error
try these two commands. I cannot damage anything. It just reconfigures and updates. Let's see the result...
thats the first thing I tried
Do you have some special /boot partition. Is it full? How many kernel versions are installed?
So you want your new kernel to be recognized...
when i install it via apt, it calls dpkg to do the post install config
this is what happens, it gets stuck in a loop with dpkg running but not doing anything
I am not really the kernel compile guru, but check your compilation and install process...
It looks like the kernel package is not built correctly.
we have to be clear about 'generate kernel'. What exact kernel package you want to install?
ok
What kernel is installed?
uanme -a in a console
Linux hostname 2.6.32-22-generic #41-Ubuntu SMP
the only way to fix apt is to purge the package from dpkg
Hmmm... Does this look familliar? https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/617454
no, i dont get an exit status
Maybe lucitu has a good idea, because I don't ;)
thanks for trying
my plesure
